DLV
Class QueryResult

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--DLV.QueryResult
public class QueryResult
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows to handle query restults.
This class works like a table of terms, an example follows. 

     Example.
 We run the following a program on DLV containig a query.
 c(a). c(b). c(c).
 b(X,X):-c(X).
 a v p.
 b(X,Y)?

 DLV will output the following result:

 a, a
 b, b
 c, c

 The QueryResult class allows to handle this result like a table.

 ..... //call dlv

 QueryResult qr=dlv.getQueryResult();

 for(int i=0; i

Field Detail

    

    


    
NO_QUERY_RESULT
    

    public static final QueryResult NO_QUERY_RESULT
    

    

    DLV queries may not have results.
 This static variable is useful to represent this case.

getTermAt
    

    public java.lang.String getTermAt(int i,
                                  int j)
    

    

    Returns the term stored in the i-th solotion and j-th variable.

getTermAt
    

    public java.lang.Object getTermAt(int i,
                                  int j,
                                  byte type)
    

    

    Returns the term stored in the i-th solotion and j-th variable and converts it
 (if possible) in the corresponding java object.

    

    

    Parameters:
    i - an integer.
    j - an integer.
    type - a valid DLV type.

    Returns:
    The term stored in the i-th solotion and j-th variable.

    Throws:

    MalformedTermException - if the term is not compatible with the specified type.
    See Also:
    ConversionType.
